settings.helpText: What services customer need like Web Design?

bio.en-US: Next.js, Tailwind CSS, MySQL, Sanity.io CMS, GraphQL, and more. Expert full-stack dev. Builds scalable web apps, integrates APIs, crafts efficient designs. Stay up-to-date, collaborative problem-solver. High-quality code, exceptional user experiences.

description.en-US: Elevate your brand with our stunning landing page design service. We create visually captivating and user-friendly landing pages that drive conversions. Let us optimize your online presence and captivate your audience in just one page.

shortDescription.en-US: The Magazine Website Template is a versatile and feature-rich web template for online magazines. It uses HTML, jQuery, and responsive design to provide an immersive reading experience on any device.

review.en-US: Abdul is knowledgeable, helped us understand our situation. He also went above and beyond making sure our project was in a good position. We look forward to working with him in the future.

Abdul helped me with some custom code for a landing page in Instapage. It was an urgent project I needed to get done during the weekend. He made exactly what I needed and pretty fast, the communication was clear and efficient. He made it easy for me. Thank you man!

Created the landing page that perfectly matched the mockup. He even suggested some good ideas to improve things. Great communication and completed everything quickly. Will work with Abdul Wahab again in the future!

title.en-US: Implementing Dark Mode in Next.js with Tailwind CSS

description.en-US: Enhance your Next.js app with Dark Mode using Tailwind CSS. Learn step-by-step implementation, seamless theme toggling, and unleash the power of Next.js and Tailwind CSS for visually stunning, user-friendly experiences.

content.value: Implementing Dark Mode

Next.js makes it easy to implement dark mode using the dark variant in Tailwind CSS. You can prependdark:to properties to indicate that they are for dark mode. For example, you can usedark:bg-gray-900to change the background color to gray-900 when the theme is set to dark. By default, Next.js uses the system preferences to set the theme.
However, we also need to toggle between light and dark modes. To do this, we can set thedarkModestrategy toclassin thetailwind.config.jsfile:
Usingnext-themes

We need to toggle between and store the current theme somehow so that when user comes back it doesn't reset to default. One way of doing this could be with local storage and doing DOM manipulation. In this blog, we'll do something way simpler and usenext-themeswhich handles all the toggling and storing of our preference.
To install the library, using npm run:
To install the library, using yarn run:
Then Create file name with ThemeProvider.tsx on components and paste this code:
In layout.tsx file wrap your component with the ThemeProvider from the component ThemeProvider.tsx
Accessibility Considerations
We can add some global styles toglobal.css. Here we set the background of the body to white in light mode and dark gray in dark mode.
Adding a Toggle Button
To allow users to toggle between light and dark modes, we need to add a toggle button to our application.
We use theuseThemehook to know what the current theme is, change the current theme using thesetThememethod, and the system theme.

Initially, we set the theme to the system theme.
Theonclickevent on the button toggles between the themes. We add some individual class using thedark:variant for the button.
Adding Elements to page.tsx
We add the toggle button topage.tsx

Contact us today for endless possibilities.

shortDescription.en-US: Adminto is a feature-packed admin dashboard panel with various graphs. It utilizes JS, CSS, Bootstrap, and HTML to create a sleek and responsive interface. The template offers both light and dark themes for a visually appealing admin dashboard experience.

The React JS Restaurant Website is a responsive and visually appealing template designed for creating restaurant websites. Built using React JS, CSS3, and animations, it offers a bakery-themed design and seamless responsiveness.

title.en-US: How to add custom icons to your next-app

description.en-US: Icons are a big part of most websites/applications. So let's take a look at how we can use React icons in a Next.js project.

content.value: Icons are a big part of most websites/applications. So let's take a look at how we can use React icons in a Next.js project.
React icons is one of the most popular icon libraries for React-based projects. It utilizes ES6 imports meaning we only load the icons we use!
We first have to add the package to our project by running the following command in your project folder to get started.
Then we can get started by importing the icons. Head over to the
React icons website
and find the icon you would like to use (use the left-hand search).
Then on the component we want to use the icon, we can import it like so:
